briefdescription.para: Model could not be loaded or accessed.
Status codes returned by the public API.
Status codes returned by the public API.

detaileddescription.para: All string fields are expected to be long-lived for the duration of engine use (or copied by the implementation).

Interpretation:
wall_time_s: total time inside generation call (includes encode, KV alloc, prefill, decode loop).
prefill_time_s: time spent in prefill only.
decode_time_s: time spent in the decode loop only.
tps_decode: tokens per second computed from decode_time_s only.
tps_total: tokens per second computed from wall_time_s (can be useful, but not for decode-only comparisons).
ttft_s: best-effort time-to-first-token (prefill + first decode step).

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_engine_params_t *p, const char *device, const char *model_dir, ie_engine_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_engine_create

parameterdescription.para: Engine params (may be NULL for defaults).
Receives the created engine pointer on success.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_engine_t *e, const char *prompt, size_t max_new, int *out_tokens, size_t *out_n_tokens)
memberdef.name: ie_engine_generate

briefdescription.para: Generate up to max_new tokens for the given prompt.

detaileddescription.para: This is the stable entrypoint that only returns token ids. For timing breakdowns, use ie_engine_generate_ex.

parameterdescription.para: Prompt string (may be empty, must be non-NULL).
Maximum number of tokens to generate.
Output buffer (length at least max_new when max_new>0).

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_engine_t *e, const char *prompt, size_t max_new, int *out_tokens, size_t *out_n_tokens, ie_generate_stats_t *out_stats)
memberdef.name: ie_engine_generate_ex

briefdescription.para: Generate tokens and optionally return timing statistics.

parameterdescription.para: Prompt string (may be empty, must be non-NULL).
Maximum number of tokens to generate.
Output buffer (length at least max_new when max_new>0).

briefdescription.para: Public C API for creating an inference engine instance and generating tokens.

detaileddescription.para:
This header intentionally keeps the interface small and stable:
The CLI can create an engine for a given (device, model_dir) pair.
Generation emits integer token ids into a caller-provided buffer.

The extended generation entrypoint can optionally return timing statistics:
Total wall time
Prefill time
Decode-loop time
Decode-only TPS (cannot be inflated by prefill)
